meanings.definition: To end the life of (a person or animal) in a painless way for reasons of mercy.
meanings.sent1: The kind vet euthanatized the old dog to end its suffering.
meanings.sent2: The family made the difficult decision to euthanatize their beloved cat.
meanings.sent3: The cat joked that it wanted to be euthanatized if it had to take a bath.
meanings.sent4: The sun's rays gently euthanatized the darkness of the night.
meanings.sent5: The peaceful meadow seemed to be euthanatized by the soft breeze.

meanings.definition: To put (a person or animal) to death in a humane way.
meanings.sent1: The shelter euthanatized the stray cat to prevent its suffering.
meanings.sent2: The injured bird had to be euthanatized to avoid further pain.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that his old car needed to be euthanatized after one too many breakdowns.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush seemed to euthanatize the blank canvas with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The gentle rain seemed to euthanatize the heat of the summer day.
